CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 11 The mobility of PDTP-DTDPP-(Bu) was measured by using a field - effect transistor ( FET ) with a bottom-gate , top - contact device configuration built on an n - doped silicon wafer. Figure 5 shows the typical output and transfer curves of a representative device with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) as the channel semiconductor. The hole mobility was estimated to be 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , which is 1-2 orders of magnitude higher than that of other effective D-A type low - bandgap photovoltaic polymers ( 2.6 x 10^-4 -3 x 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 5 Although the FET mobility might not be directly correlated to the photovoltaic performance since the situation of the charge transport is quite different from each other , the higher carrier mobility still suggests effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes in the photovoltaic devices. Photovoltaic Properties. The bulk heterojunction PSCs were fabricated with the device structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) / LiF / Al. PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated on a precleaned ITO - coated glass substrate. The film was dried at 150 °C under a N 2 atmosphere for 5 min. After cooling the substrate , a solution of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) mixture ( 1 : 2 w / w ) was spin - coated , where a blend of chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene ( 4 : 1 v / v ) was used as the solvent. The devices were completed by evaporating LiF / Al as the cathode. The effective area ( 2 mm x 3 mm ) of the PSCs was defined using a metal photomask during irradiation with simulated solar light ( Scheme 2 ). PC 70 BM was also used as an acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PCBM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region , which can compensate for the poor absorption of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) in this range. Figure 6 shows the I-V curves of the devices with the best photovoltaic performance under the illumination of AM 1.5 ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The corresponding open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) , short - circuit current ( I SC ) , fill factor ( FF ) , and PCE of the devices are also summarized in Figure 3. The external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of the devices under the illumination of monochromatic light is shown in Figure 3. Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2. Since the spectral response extends to over 1.1 μm , the spectral mismatch between the simulated and actual AM1.5 spectra must be considered.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| PCBM |
| PC 70 BM |
| LiF |
| Al |
| ITO |
| PDTP |
| DTDPP(Bu) |
| PC |
| chloroform |
| o-dichlorobenzene |
| AM 1.5 |
| monochromatic light |

Note:

* PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) is a polymer material, and its name is presented as a single entity.
* PCBM and PC 70 BM are both acceptors, and their names are presented as a single entity.
* LiF and Al are both materials used in the device structure, and their names are presented as a single entity.
* ITO is a material used in the device structure, and its name is presented as a single entity.
* PDTP and DTDPP(Bu) are both components of the PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) polymer, and their names are presented as separate entities.
* chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene are both solvents used in the spin-coating process, and their names are presented as separate entities.
* AM 1.5 and monochromatic light are both light sources used in the measurement of the devices' performance, and their names are presented as separate entities.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) |
| PCBM |
| PC 70 BM |
| LiF |
| Al |
| ITO |
| PDTP |
| DTDPP(Bu) |

Note:

* The entities that were removed were "chloroform" and "o-dichlorobenzene" as they do not clearly refer to material names. They are solvents used in the spin-coating process and do not appear to be material names.
* The entities that were kept are those that clearly refer to material names, which are:
 + PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)
 + PCBM
 + PC 70 BM
 + LiF
 + Al
 + ITO
 + PDTP
 + DTDPP(Bu)

Figure 5 shows the typical output and transfer curves of a representative device with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) as the channel semiconductor. | short-circuit current (ISC) |

Paragraph: 11 The mobility of PDTP-DTDPP-(Bu) was measured by using a field - effect transistor ( FET ) with a bottom-gate , top - contact device configuration built on an n - doped silicon wafer. Figure 5 shows the typical output and transfer curves of a representative device with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) as the channel semiconductor. Photovoltaic Properties. The bulk heterojunction PSCs were fabricated with the device structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) / LiF / Al. PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated on a precleaned ITO - coated glass substrate. The film was dried at 150 °C under a N 2 atmosphere for 5 min. After cooling the substrate , a solution of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) mixture ( 1 : 2 w / w ) was spin - coated , where a blend of chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene ( 4 : 1 v / v ) was used as the solvent. The devices were completed by evaporating LiF / Al as the cathode. The effective area ( 2 mm x 3 mm ) of the PSCs was defined using a metal photomask during irradiation with simulated solar light ( Scheme 2 ). PC 70 BM was also used as an acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PCBM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region , which can compensate for the poor absorption of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) in this range. Figure 6 shows the I-V curves of the devices with the best photovoltaic performance under the illumination of AM 1.5 ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of the devices under the illumination of monochromatic light is shown in Figure 3. Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2. Since the spectral response extends to over 1.1 μm , the spectral mismatch between the simulated and actual AM1.5 spectra must be considered.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) |
| 2.6 x 10^-4 - 3 x 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Range of hole mobility of other effective D-A type low-bandgap photovoltaic polymers |
| 1-2 orders of magnitude | Comparison of hole mobility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) to other effective D-A type low-bandgap photovoltaic polymers |
| 150 °C | Temperature for drying PEDOT:PSS film |
| 5 min | Time for drying PEDOT:PSS film |
| 4:1 v/v | Ratio of chloroform to o-dichlorobenzene in solvent for spin-coating PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM mixture |
| 2 mm x 3 mm | Effective area of PSCs |
| 100 mW/cm^2 | Intensity of simulated solar light for I-V curves |
| VOC | Open-circuit voltage |
| ISC | Short-circuit current |
| FF | Fill factor |
| PCE | Power conversion efficiency |
| 30-40 % | External quantum efficiency of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu):PC 70 BM system in the range of 450-850 nm |
| 11.31 mA/cm^2 | ISC of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu):PCBM system |
| 14.87 mA/cm^2 | ISC of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu):PC 70 BM system |
| 1.1 μm | Extension of spectral response |

Note: The property values are presented in the same units as in the original paragraph.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) |
| 2.6 x 10^-4 - 3 x 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Range of hole mobility of other effective D-A type low-bandgap photovoltaic polymers |
| 1-2 orders of magnitude | Comparison of hole mobility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) to other effective D-A type low-bandgap photovoltaic polymers |

Note: The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and were removed from the table:

* 150 °C (temperature for drying PEDOT:PSS film)
* 5 min (time for drying PEDOT:PSS film)
* 4:1 v/v (ratio of chloroform to o-dichlorobenzene in solvent for spin-coating PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM mixture)
* 2 mm x 3 mm (effective area of PSCs)
* 100 mW/cm^2 (intensity of simulated solar light for I-V curves)
* VOC (open-circuit voltage)
* ISC (short-circuit current)
* FF (fill factor)
* PCE (power conversion efficiency)
* 30-40 % (external quantum efficiency of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu):PC 70 BM system in the range of 450-850 nm)
* 11.31 mA/cm^2 (ISC of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu):PCBM system)
* 14.87 mA/cm^2 (ISC of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu):PC 70 BM system)
* 1.1 μm (extension of spectral response)
